segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, To indicate the type and function of a message and to transmit the identification of the message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To specify date and/or time relating to the message, such as the date and time the message is generated.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to provide information related to the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: To represent information about involved healthcare parties.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, To allocate a unique reference number to an individual party allowing each party to be referenced from other locations within the message.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation:
PNA, To specify information necessary to establish the identity of a healthcare party.
One occurrence of the segment is used to specify the identity details at one level. If both organisation, department and/or physician are to be specified then a separate occurrence of this segment has to be used for each of them.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To specify alternative identification numbers of a healthcare party.

segment.name: Organisation classification details
segment.documentation: SPR, To specify the medical speciality and type of a healthcare organisation.

segment.name: Qualification
segment.documentation: QUA, To specify the qualification of a healthcare professional.

segment.name: Employment details
segment.documentation: EMP, A segment to specify the type, medical speciality and the position or military rank of a healthcare professional.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, To specify an address of a healthcare party.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To specify a communication number of a party.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation:
RFF, A segment to specify a link to a higher level healthcare organisation which the actual healthcare organisation or healthcare professional is a part of.
This segment is only used if multiple occurrences of this segment group is needed to express the information of a healthcare party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: To specify a document or message to be returned to the actual party as a response to this message.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, To specify the type of the requested document or message.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To identify the requested communication method.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: CAV-SG4-SG5-SG6-SG7 A group of segments to describe the subject of care.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, To specify the type of subject of care such as a person, group of persons, an animal or a group of animals.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, To specify the name and official ID of the person or the identification of a group of persons, animal or animal group.

segment.name: Person demographic information
segment.documentation: PDI, To specify the gender of the person or animal.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To specify an alternative identification numbers for the subject of care.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To specify a date and/or time related to the subject of care such as date and time of birth or age.

segment.name: Nationality
segment.documentation: NAT, To specify the nationality of the person.

segment.name: Agreement identification
segment.documentation: AGR, To specify the basis of entitlement to health services and any confidentiality constraint that applies to the handling of information about the subject of care.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, To specify the breed and species of an animal.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, To specify the authenticity of the person's identity by the prescriber, such as person known by prescriber, person unknown, etc.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to provide information relating to the subject of care, such as a confidentiality constraint concerning a person or age of a group of animals.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, To specify the language of the person.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, To specify the person's ability in the language.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify any precaution advice concerning the subject of care.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, To specify a precaution as a code.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to specify a precaution.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To specify an associated date for the precaution such as start or end date and/or time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify an address and related communication number(s) of the actual party.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, To specify an address of the subject of care.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To specify a communication number for the subject of care at the specific address.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A segment group to provide information about a related party such as next-of-kin or animal carer.

segment.name: Relationship
segment.documentation: REL, To specify the type of relationship between the subject of care and the related party.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, To specify information necessary to establish the identity of a related party.

segment.name: Person demographic information
segment.documentation: PDI, To specify the gender of the person.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, To specify an address of a patient related party.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To specify a communication number of a patient related party.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, To specify a language of the person.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, To specify the person's ability in the language.

segmentGroup.documentation:
Segment group 7: This segment group contains clinical information about the patient such as medical history, investigation results, medication records or allergies.
Each occurrence of this segment group provides information concerning a single clinical information item.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, To allocate an identification number to the clinical information item.

segment.name: Clinical information
segment.documentation: CIN, To specify the type of clinical information item and possibly a medical diagnosis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To specify start and/or end date and/or time for the clinical information item and/or date and/or time of the origin of the clinical information item.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation:
PNA, To specify information necessary to establish the identity of the party providing the clinical information item.
One occurrence of the segment is used to specify the identity details at one level. If both organisation, department and/or physician are to be specified then a separate occurrence of this segment has to be used for each of them.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, To specify the language of the clinical information item.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to specify an item of clinical information.

segment.name: Result
segment.documentation: RSL, To specify a clinical investigation result item, such as the height or weight of the subject of care or the result of a laboratory investigation.

segment.name: Clinical intervention
segment.documentation:
CLI, To specify a clinical examination such as a height measurement.
Multiple occurrences of this segment may be needed if a multi-axial coding scheme is being used.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation:
CCI, To specify a characteristic of a laboratory investigation.
Multiple occurrences of this segment may be needed if a multi-axial coding scheme is being used.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify current or past medication or known allergy.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment to identify a medicinal product item.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, To specify the medicinal treatment status such as commenced, stopped or a patient allergy.

segment.name: Dosage administration
segment.documentation: DSG, To specify the form of presentation or the route of administration of the medicinal product as well as dosage administration or trigger for administration.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, To specify an instruction for use.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to provide comments to dosage administration.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, To specify a dosage pattern as structured information.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, To specify a quantity concerning the medicine such as a single dose or strength of tablet.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: SG12-SG14 A group of segments to specify a set of prescriptions issued for a subject of care.

segment.name: General indicator
segment.documentation: GIS, To specify the service type of the prescription set such as a new prescription, a modification of an earlier prescription or cancellation of a prescription.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To identify the prescription set and the coding scheme used for identification of the medicinal product(s).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and/or time relevant for the prescription set such as issue date of prescription set or requested date and time of dispensing.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment to specify the requested priority for dispensing.

segment.name: Agreement identification
segment.documentation: AGR, To specify the agreed disposal of the prescribed medicinal product(s) such as to be used by the client or for distribution.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment to specify the language of the prescription set.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, To specify the status of the prescription set such as requested, prescribed or dispensed.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to provide comments to the prescription set.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify a reference to a related message or document.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, To specify the type of message or document being referenced.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To identify a referenced message or document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, To specify issue date and/or time for a referenced message or document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to specify where the dispensed medicine is to be delivered or collected.

segment.name: Terms of delivery or transport
segment.documentation: TOD, To specify how the dispensed medicine(s) will be delivered or collected.

segment.name: Details of transport
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to specify the mode of transport for the delivery of dispensed medicine(s).

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to specify the delivery of the dispensed medicine(s).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and/or time relevant for the delivery of the dispensed medicine(s) such as date and time of delivery.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment to specify the address for delivery of the dispensed medicine(s).

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a telecommunication number for the receiver at the dispensed medicine delivery point.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment to identify the receiver of a dispensed medicine.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment to specify the requested priority for the delivery of the dispensed medicine(s).

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, To specify if special packaging is required.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to specify the party responsible in part or in whole for the payment and the related payment conditions for the dispensed medicine(s) in the actual prescription set.

segment.name: Financial charges allocation
segment.documentation: FCA, To specify the responsibility for the settlement of charges, i.e. whether the costs are to be paid by the patient, by private insurance, etc.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation:
PNA, To specify information necessary to establish the identity of the payer.
One occurrence of the segment is used to specify the identity details at one level. Thus two occurrences of this segment may be needed if both organisation and department are being used.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To identify a payer.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, To specify a national requirement or condition.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to specify a payment condition.

segment.name: Insurance cover description
segment.documentation: ICD, To specify insurance cover type and care coverage.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, To specify a reason for reduced or no payment.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, To specify percentage to be paid as the contribution of the payer.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, To specify a monetary amount as the contribution of the payer.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To specify a reference for the authorisation of this service.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and/or time relevant to this payment condition such as date of authorisation.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: PRC-DTM-STS-CIN-FTX-SG15-SG16-SG17 A group of segments to specify the information about a single prescription item.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment to specify a prescription item identification and request for notification information related to variation in delivery such as a substituted item or delivery failure.

segment.name: Dosage administration
segment.documentation: DSG, A segment to specify the form of presentation of the medicinal product.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment to identify a medicinal product item and the type of the item.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, To specify a quantity concerning the medicine regime such as number of units of supply or strength of tablet.

segment.name: Product group information
segment.documentation: PGI, A segment to specify the group in which the medicine belongs such as legal category or price category.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment to specify the supplier of the medicinal product, the manufacturer of the medicinal product or the initial prescriber of the treatment.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment to specify the type of package and the number of physical units.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To identify the package or to give an alternative identification of the initial authoriser.

segment.name: Delivery limitations
segment.documentation: DLM, To specify limitations on dispensing such as allowed substitution type if any.

segment.name: Number of units
segment.documentation: EQN, To specify the number of times dispensing to be repeated.

segment.name: Process identification
segment.documentation: PRC, A segment to specify information about the preparation of an extemporaneously dispensed medicine.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and/or time or period concerning the prescribing of the dispensed medicine such as dispensing interval or initial date of treatment.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, To specify the status of the dispensed medicine provided such as requested, dispensed, etc.

segment.name: Clinical information
segment.documentation: CIN, To specify the indication for the prescribed item and/or comments concerning the prescribed item expressed as a clinical code.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, expressing the indication for the prescribed item, package description, comments concerning the prescribed item or other information about this prescription item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments to specify information about a single ingredient.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify the function of the ingredient such as active or excipient ingredient.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment to identify the ingredient.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify the quantity for an ingredient.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to provide comments about the ingredient.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: LAN-EQA A group of segments to specify how the dispensed medicine should be administered and used.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, To allocate a sequential regimen phase number.

segment.name: Dosage administration
segment.documentation:
DSG, To specify how the dispensed medicine is administered.
If this information is provided in a structured way then this segment is used for route of administration or trigger for administration.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify a quantity related to dosage of the dispensed medicine such as the single dose or maximum daily dose.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, To instruct the dispenser that an exceptional dosage regimen is intended.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and/or time or period concerning dosage of the dispensed medicine such as duration of treatment or time of administration.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, to provide information relating to the medicine dosage and administration.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, To specify a dosage pattern and dosage frequency as structured information.

segment.name: Clinical information
segment.documentation: CIN, A segment to specify the indication for the use of the dispensed medicine.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, To specify a cautionary or advisory label.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment to specify the language of the instructions.

segment.name: Attached equipment
segment.documentation: EQA, To specify device or equipment to be used for the administration of the dispensed medicine.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments to specify the party that is responsible in part or in whole for the payment of the actual prescription item and the related payment conditions.

segment.name: Financial charges allocation
segment.documentation: FCA, To specify the responsibility for the settlement of charges, i.e. whether the costs are to be paid by the patient, by private insurance, etc.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation:
PNA, To specify information necessary to establish the identity of the payer.
One occurrence of the segment is used to specify the identity details at one level. Thus two occurrences of this segment may be needed if both organisation and department are being used.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To identify a payer.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, To specify a national requirement or condition.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments to specify a payment condition.

segment.name: Insurance cover description
segment.documentation: ICD, To specify the insurance cover type and care coverage.

segment.name: Allowance or charge
segment.documentation: ALC, To specify a reason for reduced or no payment.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, To specify percentage to be paid as the contribution of the payer.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, To specify a monetary amount as the contribution of the payer.

segment.name: Identity
segment.documentation: IDE, To specify a reference for the authorisation of this service.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and/or time relevant to this payment condition such as date of authorisation.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment to provide the number of prescription items in the message.
